other_tests.findings: Layering gallbladder sludge, distended gallbladder with irregular thickening and enhancement, pericholecystic stranding, 6 mm T1 hyperintense calculus at the cystic duct/gallbladder neck junction, dilated common bile duct measuring approximately 11 mm, dilatation of intrahepatic biliary radicles, minimal edema, normal pancreatic duct, tiny cystic structure likely side branch IPMN at the pancreatic head, no suspicious focal hepatic lesions, normal spleen and kidneys, small likely reactive lymph nodes at porta hepatis, patent SMV, splenic vein, portal vein and intrahepatic portal veins, no retroperitoneal lymphadenopathy, no evidence of abnormally dilated loops of bowel, small right pleural effusion with associated atelectasis.
